title: Initialize an RStudio Project or a Shiny Application
text: can customize lot options addinit, example names directories create default author scripts. just modify parameters list set option addinit .Rprofile. examples, changing author directories’ names select package shiny default :
code: my_custom_params <- list(   author = NULL,   project = list(     folders = list(       default = c("scripts", "datas", "funs", "inputs", "outputs", "logs"),       selected = NULL     ),     packages = list(       default = rownames(installed.packages()),       selected = NULL     ),     config = TRUE,     source_funs = FALSE   ),   application = list(     folders = list(       default = c("datas", "funs", "modules", "www"),       selected = NULL     ),     packages = list(       default = rownames(utils::installed.packages()),       selected = NULL     ),     create_template = TRUE,     template = "dashboard"   ) ) options("addinit" = my_custom_params) my_custom_params <- list(   author = "Victor",   project = list(     folders = list(       default = c("R", "inst", "man", "data-raw", "data", "tests"),       selected = c("R", "man")     ),     packages = list(       default = rownames(utils::installed.packages()),       selected = "shiny"     )   ) ) options("addinit" = my_custom_params)

text: can change default parameters want, look example , full list parameters : author: value use default author input, used creating script template. folders.default: names directories create. folders.selected: Select folders create default. packages.default: vector packages load scripts, default packages installed. packages.selected: Select packages load default. config: Add config script root projects loading data, sourcing funs, ... source_funs: Add code source functions. create_template: Make Shiny template selection appear. template: Template create, `shiny` classic shiny app (ui, server, global), `dashboard` use shinydashboard, `miniapp` single file app (app.R)

title: Initialize an 'RStudio' Project or a Shiny Application — initProject
code: if (FALSE) { # you can launch the addin via the RStudio Addins menu # or in the console : addinit::initProject()  # Change default parameters # (you can put this in your Rprofile) : my_custom_params <- list(   author = "Your Name",   project = list(     folders = list(       default = c("R", "inst", "man", "data-raw", "data", "tests"),       selected = c("R", "man")     ),     packages = list(       default = rownames(installed.packages()),       selected = "shiny"     )   ) ) options("addinit" = my_custom_params)  # Then relaunch the addin }
